skills these are not described in the pattern understanding of the skill is required if you need assistance a quick internet search should provide written and video instructions crochet stitches used american terms sewing stitches used ● chain ● running ● slip_stitch ● whip ● single_crochet ● back ● single_crochet increase ● straight* ● single_crochet decrease ● french knot* ● half_double_crochet ● square knot ● double_crochet other ● metal work using pliers and/or jump ring tools to open and close jump rings ● bead crochet adding beads or charms to a crochet chain pattern notes gauge is not essential for this project all sections are worked in the round unless otherwise noted a running stitch marker can be used to keep track of the row you are on instructions in brackets indicate a repeating pattern for example 1 single_crochet single_crochet increase 1 single_crochet would be worked across 3 stitches of the previous row work the number of times specified leave at least 4 inch ends unless otherwise noted before stuffing handle the ends give them a little tug to ensure they aren t sticking out the front of the piece or distorting your stitches hide ends do not cut ends tie ends together using a square knot inside the piece loosely and use as stuffing where possible no sense wasting yarn bury ends weave the tail to the closest stuffed piece and run it through for several inches then out of the piece cut close to fabric use a hook that gives you a tight fabric so the polyfill doesn t show through but not so tight it hurts your hands to work with it it should not buckle in on itself start with a hook 2 sizes smaller than called for on the chosen yarn label go up or down a size as necessary dressing a ruffle requires the manual manipulation of the fabric to achieve consistent folds and height be patient with it and the folds will fall into place instead of looking like a brain © caryn shepler a k a beadedgeek 2025 3 thou dost jest these are the advanced techniques used by the designer as seen in the photos all of these can be found with a quick internet search usually with a video you are not required to use these to finish the project you can use whichever method with which you are comfortable ● invisible decrease ● invisible join ● invisible color change ● invisible bind/fasten_off ● double magic_ring these will not be explicitly used in the pattern standard terminology as published by the craft yarn council https //www craftyarncouncil com/ will be used choose your own while you can make design decisions as you work through the project
